text: Symbol rate (also called baud rate and modulation rate) is the number of symbols that happen each second.What’s The Difference Between Bit Rate And Baud Rate? | Electronic Design The name "baud rate" comes from Émile Baudot, the person who invented the Baudot code. 'Symbol' in this sense means something like 'basic signal event'. The word symbol usually has a much wider meaning. ==References== Category:Telecommunications
title: Symbol rate
